job_description:
Junior Service Reliability Engineer

(1-2 years experience)

Location: [WFO - Kochi] Team: Engineering & Risk Operations

Role Summary

We are looking for a Junior Service Reliability Engineer to help ensure the resilience, performance, and integrity of our fintech platform. In this hybrid role, you will drive efforts to maintain service uptime, while also using data-driven analysis to detect, respond to and mitigate fraudulent activities. You’ll work at the intersection of engineering, risk, and operations—ensuring both our systems and our customers remain protected. This is a high-impact position ideal for someone with 1-2 years of experience, who thrives in a fast-paced, mission-critical payments or fintech environment.

Key Responsibilities

Service Reliability Engineering

  • Ensure high availability and performance of our customer-facing services and payment systems.
  • Design and implement observability and alerting strategies using Datadog, PagerDuty, and custom dashboards.
  • Troubleshoot alerts/logs/db across infrastructure, applications, and APIs, and perform root cause analysis.
  • Define and manage SLIs/SLOs/SLAs to measure and improve system health.
  • Develop and maintain automation scripts and tools for system provisioning, health checks, and failovers.
  • Collaborate with development and infrastructure teams to ensure scalable, fault-tolerant designs.

Fraud Detection & Risk Monitoring

  • Leverage Splunk/Datadog, internal logs, and behavioral data to monitor suspicious transaction patterns in real-time.
  • Investigate alerts, anomalies, and user behaviors to detect fraud, abuse, or financial risk exposure.
  • Tune detection rules, triggers, and risk signals based on observed fraud trends.
  • Work closely with compliance, fraud operations, and customer support on case investigation and resolution.
  • Develop and maintain dashboards and reports on fraud KPIs, incident metrics, and operational trends.
  • Participate in cross-functional fraud response processes and post-incident reviews.

Required Qualifications

  • 1-2+ years of experience in a combined SRE, DevOps, fraud analyst, or security operations role.
  • Strong experience with monitoring and alerting tools: Datadog, PagerDuty, Splunk.
  • Proficiency with Linux, shell scripting, and infrastructure troubleshooting in cloud environments (AWS, GCP, or Azure).
  • Solid understanding of service observability, incident response, and CI/CD pipelines.
  • Experience with fraud detection workflows or risk monitoring in fintech, payments, or transaction-heavy systems.
  • Comfortable writing queries (SQL, Splunk SPL) and working with large volumes of log or event data.
  • Strong collaboration skills and the ability to communicate clearly with technical and non-technical stakeholders.

Nice to Have

  • Exposure to KYC/AML systems or fraud detection frameworks in regulated environments.
  • Familiarity with secure API architecture, authentication flows (OAuth2, JWT), and access control.
  • Knowledge of PCI-DSS, ISO 27001, ISO-8583 or other financial compliance frameworks.
  • Hands-on experience with rule engines or anomaly detection models.
  • Certifications like AWS DevOps Engineer, CFE (Certified Fraud Examiner), or similar.

What You’ll Get

  • A unique opportunity to work across both service reliability and fraud detection.
  • Impactful work supporting secure, high-volume payment operations.
  • A collaborative, data-driven culture with a strong engineering and risk mindset.
  • Career growth through ownership of complex systems and security initiatives.

If this opportunity aligns with your career goals, kindly share your updated resume with us at lavanya.a@arttechgroup.com
summary: Junior SRE to ensure fintech platform resilience and detect fraud. Requires 1-2 years experience in SRE/DevOps and monitoring tools like Datadog and Splunk.

job_description:
Data Engineer

About Techversant:

Techversant is a global technology services and solutions company with over 17 years of experience, providing high-quality end-to-end IT solutions and services worldwide. We specialize in Digital Transformation, understanding evolving industrial scenarios, investment priorities, and technology disruption. Our expertise spans multiple technology domains including ColdFusion, Python, Java, .NET, Node JS, Ruby on Rails, Golang, PHP, Artificial Intelligence, Blockchain, iOS, Android, Flutter, React Native, Angular, and React Vue, catering to various industry verticals globally.

What’s important to us:

We are seeking a skilled and experienced Data Engineer with over 4 years of professional experience in building, automating, and optimizing data pipelines and cloud-based architectures. The ideal candidate will have hands-on experience with cloud data services (AWS, Azure, or GCP) and CI/CD pipelines for deploying scalable, reliable, and secure data solutions. You will collaborate with cross-functional teams including data analysts, data scientists, and software engineers to design and maintain robust data infrastructure that supports analytics, AI/ML workflows, and enterprise reporting systems.

Key Responsibilities:

  • Design, build, and maintain end-to-end ETL/ELT pipelines using both on-premise and cloud-based technologies.
  • Architect and operate data storage and streaming solutions leveraging cloud-based services on AWS, Azure, or GCP.
  • Design and implement data ingestion and transformation workflows using Airflow, AWS Glue, or Azure Data Factory.
  • Develop and optimize data pipelines using Python and PySpark for large-scale distributed data processing.
  • Build data models — normalized, denormalized, and dimensional (Star/Snowflake) — for analytics and warehousing solutions.
  • Implement data quality, lineage, and governance using metadata management and monitoring tools.
  • Collaborate with cross-functional teams to deliver clean, reliable, and timely data for analytics and machine learning use cases.
  • Integrate CI/CD pipelines for data infrastructure deployment using GitHub Actions, Jenkins, or Azure DevOps.
  • Automate infrastructure provisioning using Infrastructure as Code (IaC) tools such as AWS CloudFormation or Terraform.
  • Monitor and optimize data processing performance for scalability, reliability, and cost-efficiency.
  • Enforce data security policies and ensure compliance with standards such as GDPR and HIPAA.

Must-Have Skills & Qualifications:

  • Education: Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, Data Engineering, or a related field.
  • Experience: Minimum 4 years of hands-on experience as a Data Engineer or in data-intensive environments.
  • SQL Expertise: Advanced proficiency in SQL for complex queries, joins, window functions, and performance tuning.
  • Analytical Databases: Experience working with Snowflake, Amazon Redshift, Google BigQuery, Azure Synapse, and PostgreSQL.
  • Query Optimization: Skilled in query optimization, indexing, and execution plan analysis for high-performance analytics workloads.
  • Programming: Proficient in Python and PySpark for data manipulation, automation, and pipeline orchestration.
  • Data Processing Frameworks: Strong understanding of Apache Spark (RDD, DataFrame, Spark SQL, optimization), Hive, Hadoop, and Flink for large-scale distributed data processing.
  • ETL/ELT Frameworks: Hands-on experience designing and maintaining pipelines using Airflow, AWS Glue, or Azure Data Factory.
  • Data Integration Patterns: Familiar with incremental loading, Slowly Changing Dimensions (SCD), Change Data Capture (CDC), and error handling in data pipelines.
  • Data Modeling: Expertise in data modeling, schema design, and building normalized, denormalized, and dimensional (Star/Snowflake) schemas.
  • Data Architecture: Strong understanding of Data Warehousing, Data Lakes, and Lakehouse architectures, including Delta Lake, ACID transactions, and partitioning strategies.
  • Cloud Platforms: Practical experience with major cloud ecosystems:
  • AWS: S3, Glue, Redshift, Athena, Lambda, Step Functions, EMR
  • Azure: Data Factory, Data Lake Gen2, Synapse, Databricks
  • Cloud Security: Experience managing IAM roles, access control, and encryption in cloud environments.
  • Pipeline Optimization: Skilled in optimizing data pipelines for performance, scalability, and cost-efficiency.
  • CI/CD and DevOps: Hands-on experience with CI/CD tools such as GitHub Actions, GitLab CI, or Azure DevOps.
  • Version Control: Proficient with Git and familiar with agile development practices.

Preferred Skills:

  • Experience with containerization and orchestration.
  • Exposure to data cataloging and governance tools.
  • Experience with monitoring tools.
  • Familiarity with data APIs and microservices architecture.
  • Certification in cloud data engineering (e.g., AWS Certified Data Engineer, Azure Data Engineer Associate, or GCP Professional Data Engineer).
  • Experience supporting machine learning and analytics pipelines.

Soft Skills:

  • Strong analytical and problem-solving mindset.
  • Excellent communication and documentation skills.
  • Ability to work collaboratively in a cross-functional, fast-paced environment.
  • Strong attention to detail with a focus on data accuracy and reliability.
  • Eagerness to learn and adopt emerging data technologies.

What Company Offers:

  • Long-term growth opportunities.

job_description:
Full Stack Developer

Company: NewAgeSys IT (a division of NewAgeSys) Location: Carnival Infopark, Phase 2, Kakkanad, Ernakulam Job Type: Onsite Shift Timing: 11 AM - 8 PM

About the Company

NewAgeSys IT, a division of NewAgeSys, Inc. established in 1994, based in New Jersey, specializes in mobile app development and consulting. We help clients maximize their business reach and effectiveness by leveraging the latest technology. As a full-service mobile and web development firm, NewAgeSMB focuses on clients across North America, UK, Europe, Middle East, Singapore, and Australia. We build long-term relationships, from brainstorming and strategizing to building, deploying, and providing support and maintenance for cost-effective solutions.

About the Job

As a Full Stack Developer at NewAgeSys, you will build fully-fledged platforms using a range of technologies, involved in the entire product development lifecycle including design, development, deployment, and maintenance of new and existing features. You will write clean, functional code on both the front-end and back-end, collaborate closely with the development team to ensure system consistency and a great user experience, and write reusable and maintainable code. You will optimize web design for mobile for maximum speed and perform UI tests to enhance performance. Ultimately, your work will directly impact the stability and user experience of our products.

Full Stack Developer Responsibilities:

  • Be comfortable working with both front-end and back-end languages.
  • Have knowledge of multiple back-end languages (Node JS primarily) and JavaScript frameworks (like ReactJS and Vue).
  • Have knowledge of multiple front-end languages and libraries (like HTML, CSS, and JavaScript).

  • Architecture & System Design:

  • Data Engineering:

  • Product & Project Ownership:

    • Ability to estimate efforts, manage scope, and align delivery with client expectations.
    • Experience in productizing AI models and integrating them into full-stack applications.

  • Soft Skills:

    • Excellent communication, stakeholder management, and presentation skills.
    • Ability to simplify complex AI concepts for non-technical stakeholders.

Preferred/Nice-to-Have:

  • Experience with Generative AI (LLMs, GPT, BERT, Stable Diffusion, LangChain, RAG, etc.).
  • Knowledge of Prompt Engineering, Fine-Tuning, and RLHF.
  • Experience in NLP, Computer Vision, Time Series, or Recommendation Engines.

About Techversant:

Techversant is a global technology services and solutions company with over 17 years of experience, providing high-quality end-to-end IT Solutions and Services. What's Important to Us:

We are seeking a skilled and experienced Data Engineer with over 4 years of professional experience in building, automating, and optimizing data pipelines and cloud-based architectures. The ideal candidate will have hands-on experience with cloud data services (AWS, Azure, or GCP) and CI/CD pipelines for deploying scalable, reliable, and secure data solutions. You will collaborate with cross-functional teams including data analysts, data scientists, and software engineers to design and maintain robust data infrastructure supporting analytics, AI/ML workflows, and enterprise reporting systems.

Key Responsibilities:

  • Design, build, and maintain end-to-end ETL/ELT pipelines using both on-premise and cloud-based technologies.
  • Architect and operate data storage and streaming solutions leveraging cloud-based services on AWS, Azure, or GCP.
  • Design and implement data ingestion and transformation workflows using Airflow, AWS Glue, or Azure Data Factory.
  • Develop and optimize data pipelines using Python and PySpark for large-scale distributed data processing.
  • Build data models — normalized, denormalized, and dimensional (Star/Snowflake) — for analytics and warehousing solutions.
  • Implement data quality, lineage, and governance using metadata management and monitoring tools.
  • Collaborate with cross-functional teams to deliver clean, reliable, and timely data for analytics and machine learning use cases.
  • Integrate CI/CD pipelines for data infrastructure deployment using GitHub Actions, Jenkins, or Azure DevOps.
  • Automate infrastructure provisioning using Infrastructure as Code (IaC) tools such as AWS CloudFormation or Terraform.
  • Monitor and optimize data processing performance for scalability, reliability, and cost-efficiency.
  • Enforce data security policies and ensure compliance with standards such as GDPR and HIPAA.

Must-Have Skills & Qualifications:

  • Education: Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, Data Engineering, or a related field.
  • Experience: Minimum 4 years of hands-on experience as a Data Engineer or in data-intensive environments.
  • SQL Expertise: Advanced proficiency in SQL for complex queries, joins, window functions, and performance tuning.
  • Analytical Databases: Experience working with Snowflake, Amazon Redshift, Google BigQuery, Azure Synapse, and PostgreSQL.
  • Query Optimization: Skilled in query optimization, indexing, and execution plan analysis for high-performance analytics workloads.
  • Programming: Proficient in Python and PySpark for data manipulation, automation, and pipeline orchestration.
  • Data Processing Frameworks: Strong understanding of Apache Spark (RDD, DataFrame, Spark SQL, optimization), Hive, Hadoop, and Flink for large-scale distributed data processing.
  • ETL/ELT Frameworks: Hands-on experience designing and maintaining pipelines using Airflow, AWS Glue, or Azure Data Factory.
  • Data Integration Patterns: Familiar with incremental loading, Slowly Changing Dimensions (SCD), Change Data Capture (CDC), and error handling in data pipelines.
  • Data Modeling: Expertise in data modeling, schema design, and building normalized, denormalized, and dimensional (Star/Snowflake) schemas.
  • Data Architecture: Strong understanding of Data Warehousing, Data Lakes, and Lakehouse architectures, including Delta Lake, ACID transactions, and partitioning strategies.
  • Cloud Platforms: Practical experience with major cloud ecosystems:
    • AWS: S3, Glue, Redshift, Athena, Lambda, Step Functions, EMR
    • Azure: Data Factory, Data Lake Gen2, Synapse, Databricks
  • Cloud Security: Experience managing IAM roles, access control, and encryption in cloud environments.
  • Pipeline Optimization: Skilled in optimizing data pipelines for performance, scalability, and cost-efficiency.
  • CI/CD and DevOps: Hands-on experience with CI/CD tools such as GitHub Actions, GitLab CI, or Azure DevOps.
  • Version Control: Proficient with Git and familiar with agile development practices.

Preferred Skills:

  • Experience with containerization and orchestration.
  • Exposure to data cataloging and governance tools.
  • Experience with monitoring tools.
  • Familiarity with data APIs and microservices architecture.
  • Certification in cloud data engineering (e.g., AWS Certified Data Engineer, Azure Data Engineer Associate, or GCP Professional Data Engineer).
  • Experience supporting machine learning and analytics pipelines.

Soft Skills:

  • Excellent communication and documentation skills.
  • Ability to work collaboratively in a cross-functional, fast-paced environment.
  • Strong attention to detail with a focus on data accuracy and reliability.

  • Certifications (Preferred):
    • Microsoft Certified: Dynamics 365 Finance and Operations Apps Developer Associate
    • Microsoft Certified: Dynamics 365 Developer Associate (CRM/CE)

D365 FinOps, Microsoft Dynamics 365, CRM, FinOps, APIs, Power Platform

Skills - Primary

D365 FinOps, Microsoft Dynamics 365, CRM, FinOps

Familiarity with Azure services (Logic Apps, Functions, etc.)
